subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Comfortable Clothing:  Wear comfortable, casual clothing suitable for walking and wine tasting.

The South of France is home to many iconic dishes that you must try during your visit: • Bouillabaisse: A traditional fish stew from Marseille, made with various types of fish, shellfish, and a flavorful broth seasoned with saﬀron and herbs. Bouillabaisse is typically served with rouille, a garlic ky mayonnaise, and crusty bread. The dish is a celebration of the sea and is best enjoyed in a seaside restaurant with a view of the Mediterranean. • Ratatouille: A vegetable stew made with eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onions, seasoned wit h herbs de Provence. Ratatouille can be served as a main

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Provence : Learn to prepare traditional dishes like ratatouille and bouillabaisse. • Périgord : Join a truﬄe hunting tour followed by a cooking class. • Nice : Take a class to master Niçoise cuisine, including dishes like salade niçoise and socca. • Toulouse : Learn to cook regional specialties such as cassoulet.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Restaurants and Hotels.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • AM by Alexandre Mazzia  (Marseille): A two -Michelin -starred restaurant oﬀering a fine-dining experience with innovative dishes inspired by Mediterranean flavors. The artistic presentation and unique flavor combinations make it a culinary adventure. • Le Mirazur (Menton): Ranked a mong the world's best restaurants, Le Mirazur oﬀers a unique dining experience with a focus on fresh, local ingredients and innovative

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Traditions and Culture.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Provençal Cuisine Provençal cuisine is characterized by its use of f resh, local ingredients and Mediterranean flavors. Olive oil, garlic, tomatoes, and herbs such as thyme, rosemary, and basil are staples in Provençal dishes. Some iconic dishes include ratatouille, a vegetable stew; bouillabaisse, a fish soup; and tapenade , an olive spread. Provençal cuisine reflects the region's agricultural heritage and its emphasis on simple, flavorful cooking.
